title: A Waiting Wave
description: “Deft and entertaining... Kulpreet's touch is surprisingly assured.”Upamanyu Chatterjee, Author of the cult Indian classic ‘English August’ "Kulpreet Yadav's passionate story brings the Andamans to life in such vivid detail that it made me long to drop everything and go there at once."Indra Sinha, shortlisted for the Man Booker Prize, 2007 and regional winner, Commonwealth Writer’s Prize, 2008The British abandoned their mansions. The Japanese gave up their bunkers. And the Dutch departed in a hurry forgetting to ship their cows back to Europe. Yes, the book is set in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, an Indian territory in the Bay of Bengal. Engaging and unpredictable, this is the life-changing story of Harry and Kareena, married and once in love, who are brought back together by a devastating Tsunami.
author: Kulpreet Yadav
